intro: Dyschoriste volkensii, commonly known as the African horned violets, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to eastern and southern Africa. The plant features distinctive, velvety leaves with a waxy coating and produces small, showy flowers in shades of purple and white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Dyschoriste volkensii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in a garden setting.
